content: SECTION 1. APPROVAL OF THE AGREEMENT BETWEEN THE UNITED STATES AND THE REPUBLIC OF PALAU. Definitions: Agreement refers to the document signed by the United States and Palau on September 3, 2010. Compact of Free Association refers to the agreement between the US and Palau. Results of Compact Review: Title I of Public Law 99-658 is amended to include a section on the results of the Compact review. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 are approved, with exceptions and subject to certain provisions. If Palau withdraws over $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal year 2011, funds may be withheld. The Agreement signed between the United States and the Republic of Palau allows for funds to be withheld if Palau withdraws more than $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013. Additionally, funding for certain provisions under Section 105 of the Compact of Free Association will be transferred within 30 days of enactment. Within 30 days of enactment, the Secretary of the Treasury will transfer funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing specific sections of the Agreement. Additionally, appropriations are authorized for subsidizing postal services to Palau, the Marshall Islands, and Micronesia. Appropriations are authorized for subsidizing postal services to Palau, the Marshall Islands, and Micronesia, with $1,500,000 allocated annually from 2014 to 2024. Additionally, the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 is amended to extend a program until 2024, and a passport requirement is clarified. The text outlines the eligibility criteria for certain individuals to be admitted to the US as nonimmigrants without certain passport requirements. This includes individuals who were citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands and have become citizens of Palau, as well as those who acquire Palauan citizenship at birth. The Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands citizens who are now citizens of Palau, those who acquire Palauan citizenship at birth, and naturalized citizens who have resided in Palau for at least five years can work in the US with permission from the Secretary of Homeland Security. Their right to establish habitual residence in a US territory may have non-discriminatory limitations.
